project_overview.name: Customer Onboarding and Success Portal (COSP)
project_overview.description: A web-based portal that will help reduce customer churn, improve time-to-value, increase CSM efficiency, and boost self-service rate for the company's SaaS product.

feature_breakdown.description: Allow customers to securely log in using their main SaaS product credentials.
acceptance_criteria: Customers can log in using their existing SaaS product credentials

feature_breakdown.description: Display a personalized onboarding checklist based on the customer's subscription level.
acceptance_criteria: Checklists are displayed based on the customer's subscription tier
Checklists include all necessary onboarding steps
Customers can track their progress through the checklists

feature_breakdown.description: Integrate with the existing knowledge base API to allow seamless content searching and viewing.
acceptance_criteria: Customers can search and view all relevant product documentation
Search results are accurate and up-to-date
Content is displayed in a user-friendly format

feature_breakdown.description: Display a dashboard showing the customer's adoption metrics (e.g., daily active users, feature usage count).
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard displays all relevant adoption metrics
Dashboard is intuitive and easy to navigate

feature_breakdown.description: Provide a 'Contact CSM' button that pre-populates an email or a Zendesk ticket with customer details.
acceptance_criteria: Customers can easily contact their CSM from the portal
Customer details are automatically included in the ticket or email
Ticket or email is routed to the correct CSM

technical_architecture.data_flow: Customer data is retrieved from the CRM and usage data APIs, processed by the microservices, and displayed in the web application. The web application also integrates with the knowledge base and Zendesk APIs to provide a seamless user experience.
security_considerations: Implement OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect for secure authentication and authorization
Use TLS 1.2+ for all communication and data encryption
Conduct regular security audits and penetration testing
Implement role-based access control (RBAC) for sensitive data and functionality

implementation_phases.description: Deliver the minimum viable product with core features to meet the 6-month timeline.
deliverables: Integrated with CRM, knowledge base, and Zendesk

implementation_phases.description: Enhance the portal with additional features to meet all business objectives.

risk_analysis.description: Delays in integrating with third-party systems (CRM, knowledge base, Zendesk)
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Engage with third-party vendors early, establish clear communication and integration plans, and allocate sufficient time for testing and troubleshooting

risk_analysis.description: Complexity in designing and implementing the personalized onboarding checklists
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Conduct thorough requirement gathering, design workshops, and prototyping to ensure the solution meets customer needs. Allocate sufficient development and testing time.

risk_analysis.description: Challenges in meeting performance and scalability requirements
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Implement a scalable and performant architecture, conduct load testing, and optimize the application for speed and responsiveness. Leverage CDN and caching mechanisms where appropriate.

success_metrics.measurement_method: Tracked from customer onboarding start to first feature adoption

success_metrics.target_value: Reduce time spent on manual onboarding tasks by 25%
success_metrics.measurement_method: Tracked through CSM activity logs and time tracking
Calculated from the percentage of support questions resolved via the portal
